entry.content:
In the "dynamic worker" case, the server can send back a

PROFILE_NOT_FOUND error. It encodes the fact that a certificate

provisioning profile that the client refers to does not exist (anymore)

in the server's policy database.

but if the carveout of physical memory doesn't change, each

renderer process can look up the feature's parameter.

entry.title: Prerender: Fix crash on navigation to non-http(s) on prerendered pages
entry.content:
Before this CL, when a prerendered page navigates to a non-http(s) URL,

CHECK(is_redirection) fails in

PrerenderNavigationThrottle::WillStartOrRedirectRequest(). This is

because the check is just too strict. This CL loosens the check and

makes sure that prerendering is canceled in the case.

entry.title: Fix AutofillTable::GetAutofillProfile() DCHECK.
entry.content:
In AutofillTable, ServerFieldTypes are stored one type per _row_ as a

list of key-value pairs (rather than one type per column). The keys are

the integer-representation of the ServerFieldTypes.

In the reading logic, a DCHECK exists that ensures that these integer

keys convert to a valid ServerFieldType.



Recently, some ServerFieldTypes were deprecated, causing this DCHECK to

fail. This CL replaces it with an if. Since the database can be modified

through external means, this shouldn't have been a DCHECK to begin with.



As of this CL, the reading logic will simply ignore deprecated types

that are still in the table. During the next update (because it is

implemented as delete + insert), deprecated types will be dropped.



If we want to ensure that deprecated types are immediately cleaned-up,

we could:

- Add database migration logic every time a type is deprecated. This

would however defeat the purpose/flexibility of the current layout.

- Automatically drop such rows on start-up.



Since today is branch point, neither of these options is implemented.

Should it be decided that this is necessary, we can follow-up.



Fixed: 1478823

Change-Id: Ifba285e1c1ca584848d7946644cccfc0daee9cc0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4841639

Reviewed-by: Norge Vizcay

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1192358}

entry.title: [iOS] Use GetLocalDataDescriptions to fetch local data types to upload.
entry.content:
This CL uses the async GetLocalDataDescriptions to fetch the local data

types and their counts to offer the upload option.



The string in the upload card should be updated dynamically. And it is

updated once GetLocalDataDescriptions has the data ready.



The changes are gated by kSyncEnableBatchUploadLocalData.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Invalidation on stylesheet changes using selector matching""
entry.content:
This reverts commit c125361b2841cfc76a48a91896bc4c049f2ace67.



Original change's description:

> Reland "Invalidation on stylesheet changes using selector matching"

>

> This is a reland of commit 5d12010188b8fd648efd2279956e8a6cbe20654e.

> The revert has been in for ~6 hours and the tests in question still

> fail on the Mac builders, so it's unlikely to be the culprit.

> It also passes locally on Mac.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Invalidation on stylesheet changes using selector matching

> >

> > When inserting, deleting or modifying stylesheets, we need to invalidate

> > style for some elements, even though the elements themselves did not

> > change. Currently, we reuse the concept of InvalidationSets, which are

> > mostly designed for changes to elements, for that. This can sometimes

> > cause overbroad invalidations, especially if the style is written in

> > a “modern” (read: less-than-ideal) fashion.

> >

> > We replace this by a somewhat slower but more precise and probably

> > simpler system; for each candidate element in the DOM, we see if it

> > matches any selectors in the old or the new rulesets (by means of

> > the same bucketing logic we currently have during element rule

> > collection), and if so, we mark it for style recalc. This isn't perfect;

> > if we are e.g. adding a single rule to an existing stylesheet, we would

> > still invalidate based on all rules in the sheet. We hope to improve

> > this in a future patch, but even now, this shows significant

> > improvements over most of blink_perf.css, with only a few regressions.

> >

> > Note that this means the experimental style invalidation information in

> > devtools becomes somewhat less useful; it will no longer give reasons

> > for invalidations when style sheets change. Fixing this would probably

> > involve extending the protocol, although I haven't looked deeply into

> > this.

> >

> > Bug: 1444522

> > Change-Id: Ib95cf8d215bf4e7b58ab1955ebc1f3c7e31aead8

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4783456

> > Commit-Queue: Steinar H Gunderson

> > Reviewed-by: Adithya Srinivasan

> > Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190433}

>

> Bug: 1444522

> Change-Id: I522f99ee0fcc59d52d396d92a9af682f6be67a60

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4830242

entry.title: Fix dangling pointers in DBus during Shutdown.
entry.content:
@alimariam reported the dangling pointer detector found a new dangling

pointer when running tests on linux Workstation.



The error is:

```

The memory was freed at:

#3 allocator_shim::internal::PartitionFree()

#4 bluez::BluezDBusThreadManager::~BluezDBusThreadManager()

#5 bluez::BluezDBusThreadManager::Shutdown()

#6 ChromeBrowserMainPartsLinux::PostDestroyThreads()

#7 content::BrowserMainLoop::ShutdownThreadsAndCleanUp()

#8 content::BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Shutdown()

#9 content::BrowserMain()

#10 content::RunBrowserProcessMain()

#11 content::ContentMainRunnerImpl::RunBrowser()

#12 content::ContentMainRunnerImpl::Run()

#13 content::RunContentProcess()

#14 content::ContentMain()

#15 ChromeMain



The dangling raw_ptr was released at:

#3 base::internal::RawPtrBackupRefImpl<>::ReleaseInternal()

#4 dbus::ObjectManager::~ObjectManager()

#5 std::__Cr::__tuple_impl<>::~__tuple_impl()

#6 base::internal::BindState<>::Destroy()

#7 base::[...]::LazilyDeallocatedDeque<>::Ring::~Ring()

#8 base::[...]::TaskQueueImpl::UnregisterTaskQueue()

#9 base::[...]::SequenceManagerImpl::UnregisterTaskQueueImpl()

#10 base::sequence_manager::TaskQueue::ShutdownTaskQueue()

#11 content::BrowserTaskQueues::~BrowserTaskQueues()

#12 content::BrowserUIThreadScheduler::~BrowserUIThreadScheduler()

#13 content::BrowserTaskExecutor::[...]::~UIThreadExecutor()

#14 content::BrowserTaskExecutor::[...]::~UIThreadExecutor()

#15 content::BrowserTaskExecutor::Shutdown()

#16 content::ContentMainRunnerImpl::Shutdown()

#17 content::RunContentProcess()

#18 content::ContentMain()

#19 ChromeMain

```



Diagnostic:

- `bluez::BluezDBusThreadManager` owns a `dbus::Bus` as `system_bus`.

- `dbus::Bus` owns:

- The set of `dbus::ObjectManager` as `object_manager_table_`.

- The DBus task runner as `dbus_task_runner_`.

- The `dbus::ObjectManager` references `dbus::Bus` via `bus_`.



So far so good, the ownership is clear. The problem happens when calling

`dbus::Bus::RemoveObjectManager`. Indeed this moves the ObjectManager

out of `dbus::Bus` toward a callback to a new thread. This still works

transitively, because the dbus::Bus owns the thread. The problem happens

after a second transfer back to the original thread.



Indeed, there is a race condition possible:



Behavior without problems: -----------------------------------



┌─────────────┐ ┌───────────┐

│Origin thread│ │DBus thread│

└──────┬──────┘ └─────┬─────┘

RemoveObjectManager() │

│────────────────────────────────>│

│ RemoveObjectManagerInternal()

│<────────────────────────────────│

RemoveObjectManagerInternalHelper() │

~ObjectManager() │

│ ┌─────┴─────┐

Shutdown DBus Thread ─────────────>│DBus thread│

Shutdown DBus Thread <─────────────│DBus thread│

│ └───────────┘

~Bus

┌──────┴──────┐

│Origin thread│

└─────────────┘



Behavior with problems: ----------------------------------------



┌─────────────┐ ┌───────────┐

│Origin thread│ │DBus thread│

└──────┬──────┘ └─────┬─────┘

RemoveObjectManager() │

│────────────────────────────────>│

│ RemoveObjectManagerInternal()

│ ┌────────────│

│ │ ┌─────┴─────┐

Shutdown DBus Thread ─────────────>│DBus thread│

Shutdown DBus Thread <─────────────│DBus thread│

│ │ └───────────┘

~Bus() │

│ │

│<───────────────────┘

RemoveObjectManagerInternalHelper()

~ObjectManager()

┌──────┴──────┐

│Origin thread│

└─────────────┘

-----------------------------------------------------------------



In the second case: ~Bus() is called before ~ObjectManager().



The fix is a use `ObjectManager::Cleanup()` to cleanup the raw_ptr while

the object is still transitively owned by the object it referenced.



Bug: chromium:1478759

Fixed: chromium:1478759

Change-Id: I4ac04d449ab8a7b860256c490f8ac878c1c5c7c5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4839496

Reviewed-by: Ryo Hashimoto

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1192343}

entry.title: [text-autospace] Reshape when the property is changed
entry.content:
This patch changes the style engine to require a reshape when

the `text-autospace` is changed.



Since `TextAutoSpace` adds spacings to `ShapeResult`, it

requires reshaping when the property value was changed.

that point is redundant.

entry.title: Introduce blocked_hosts param to ServiceWorkerAutoPreload
entry.content:
This CL add the new feature param to ServiceWorkerAutoPreload.

"blocked_hosts" could have a comma separated string containing host

names, in which the AutoPreload feature is disabled.



This mechanism is needed when we'd like to disable the feature on some

specific websites while running the experiment.

entry.title: [Clippy] Add Clippy policy checks where necessary
entry.content:
Clippy features are guarded by IsEligibleAndEnabledUploadOfficeToCloud() which doesn't take pref values into account; this CL adds pref checking by appending calls to IsMicrosoftOfficeCloudUploadDisabledByPolicy() and

IsGoogleWorkspaceCloudUploadDisabledByPolicy() where necessary.



Note that both these functions will always return false unless

kUploadOfficeToCloudForEnteprise is enabled, hence no changes to

consumer behavior is expected.



Bug: b/296282654

Change-Id: Iab2ad1ba1950730d8106fe43ec0fa82cd4fded81

entry.title: dlp: Support 2-line panel item secondary text
entry.content:
Adds support for longer secondary text in the Files App panel items /

visual signals. The text is now limited to 2 lines instead of 1, which

is currently only used for DLP and Enterprise Connectors errors and

warnings, that have a short title and long message.



Changes the panel item's height from a fixed value to "auto" with the

correct padding, so that it would be adjusted in case of 2 lines.



Before the change:

- Description longer than 1 line clipped: screen/5QRYWuV4TQpoFEz.png



Legacy style:

- Single line title & description: screen/82EEcrCB9GdnUfB.png

- Single line title & 2 in description: screen/BK7ANd27d25hEDh.png

- Both long -> clipped at 2 lines: screen/6Go7ioFZCUDAvzM.png

- Summary with a mix: screen/BK7ANd27d25hEDh.png



Refresh23 (Jelly):

- Single line title & description: screen/8Mh8hP5aGqVhj6r.png

- Single line title & 2 in description: screen/zZcuCzHKQG9HKNR.png

- Both long -> clipped at 2 lines: screen/APL2JNjuZhFVWaa.png

- Summary with a mix: screen/9eNDW6p8UR4RMGV.png

- Summary with 2 long items: screen/cTNR9ybEC2kAaW3.png





R=lucmult@chromium.org, wenbojie@chromium.org



Fixed: b:291566974

entry.title: camera: Keep signaling the cancel_pipe until the service loop stops
entry.content:
If CameraHalDispatcherImpl's destructor is called before poll, there may

be a deadlock because poll can't observe the pipe's change. This CL uses

a while loop to keep signaling the cancel_pipe until the service loop

stops.



BUG=1473194

TEST=Add a wait function to make poll() is called after cancel_pipe is

signaled. After applying this CL, Ash can be stopped normally.

entry.title: [Federated strings] Implement FederatedClientManager.
entry.content:
This is modeled on the existing implementation of the launcher

FederatedMetricsManager.



Summary of changes:



- Manages the details of a federated service mojo connection.

- Calls out to FederatedServiceController for service availability.

- Checks feature flags' statuses.



Clients will each own an instance of FederatedClientManager. This avoids

the threading complexities of maintaining a single shared

point-of-contact.



./out/Default/ash_unittests --gtest_filter="*FederatedClientManager*"`



Test: unit tests i.e. `autoninja -C out/Default ash_unittests &&

Bug: b/289140140

entry.title: Verify texture's uploaded data size on 64-bit platforms.
entry.content:
Checks added to WebGLRenderingContextBase::ValidateTexFuncData in

Issue 1344047 didn't take into account that the incoming pointer is

incremented by src_offset during the texture data upload, so that only

the size of the uploaded texture data must be constrained. On 32-bit

platforms, however, the pointer arithmetic can overflow, so the check

must be maintained there.



Fixed: 1476859

entry.content:
TabInsertionBrowserAgent::InsertWebState used to take many arguments

while there aren't any comments documenting what the arguments are for.

We anticipate more params in this method once lazy loading will be

supported, so we consolidate all the parameters into the new struct

TabInsertion::Params.

entry.title: [Federated strings] Add method for mocking out ash shell interaction.
entry.content:
Client testing may sometimes (but not always) wish to decouple the

FederatedClientManager class from its interactions with the ash shell.



In this CL:



- Add a test-only method UseFakeAshInteractionForTest().

- When called, causes a faked FederatedServiceController to be used.

- Demonstrate usage in unittest.cc.



Alternatives considered:



- Client injects desired FederatedServiceController (real or fake) via

FederatedClientManager constructor or other method.

- This can be done in the future if the flexibility is needed.

However, that degree of flexibility is not anticipated.

- This is not as simple for clients as the chosen method.



./out/Default/ash_unittests --gtest_filter="*FederatedClientManager*"`



Test: unit tests i.e. `autoninja -C out/Default ash_unittests &&

entry.title: viz: CanMergeMaskFilterInfo must also use sqs::clip_rect
entry.content:
It's quite common that a mask with rounded corners doesn't fit

a toplevel mask and it is clipped as a result.



The surface aggregator used to forbid merging these kind of masks as it treated them overlapping with the "toplevel" one. An example of such a behaviour is a typical web page, part of which is clipped to the browser window's bounds because it would otherwise span outside the browser window's space.

entry.title: [Files App] Convert ARC file filter pattern field to kFile condition
entry.content:
Convert ARC file path intent filters (which use the pattern field for

matching with file extensions) into simplified App Service intent

filters. The resulting App Service intent filter should use kFile

instead of kAuthority/kScheme/kPath. As part of this, we hide the

scheme/ host if they exist for all file filters, as file intent filters

only need either a file path extension or a mime type to specify what

files are supported.

entry.title: [Federated strings] Add skeleton of FederatedClientManager.
entry.content:
In this CL:



- Add a skeleton (.h and .cc) of new class FederatedClientManager.

- Add a skeleton unit test file.

- Instantiate the client manager at least once in a test.



The client manager abstracts away the details of communicating with

the FederatedServiceController and setting up a Mojo connection to the

FederatedService.



The manager class has a public method specific to clients of the

federated strings service. However, the manager class can easily be

extended in the future to serve generic clients or other types of

service.



For follow-up:



- (short-term) Fill in the implementation.

- (long-term) (clients) Instantiate in ash-chrome.



Test: unit test outline added, `autoninja -C out/Default ash_unittests && ./out/Default/ash_unittests --gtest_filter="*FederatedClientManager*"

entry.title: Use dedicated polling thread for wayland event
entry.content:
This patch re-enables removed basic logic of using dedicated polling

thread in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3386963



The patch removed dedicated polling thread and use

prepare/check/dispatch series with wayland client API carefully.

But it turns out there still exists the case of deadlock.

If higher priority GSource than GLibWaylandSource is used then

MessagePumpGlib could get a chance to run chromium tasks without having

called check of GLibWaylandSource because g_main_context_iteration will

not call check function of lower priority GSource if higher priority

GSource is ready.



The deadlock may be happened only when using --in-process-gpu and EGL

wayland backend so dedicated polling thread needs to be for that case.



Change-Id: Ibc98799a00989c9e205c3161b4da31cf30ddee9d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4645208

Auto-Submit: Wanchang Ryu

Reviewed-by: Maksim Sisov

Commit-Queue: Wanchang Ryu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1192260}

entry.title: lacros: Mark PresentationFeedback as failed if fail flag is present.
entry.content:
`gfx::PresentationFeedback::Flags::kFailure` does not have a

corresponding flag defined by wayland but still being sent from Ash.



This patch changes the logic in Lacros so that this failure flag is

utilised to mark the presentation as failed.



Note that in wayland, "discarded" event is defined which can be used

to represent failed presentation. However Ash-Lacros use "presented"

instead so that the message comes with a timestamp.



Test: ozone_unittests

Bug: 1468873

Change-Id: I28848bfe699d0bd39c5d2e8a00ce1f68d03b3f07

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4790510

entry.title: [Fast Pair] Enable configuring companion app Play store link
entry.content:
Adds feature parameter and logic to enable linking to the Play store

from the fast pair PWA companion notification. Surfaces a new "install"

specific notification. If no Play store link is configured, falls back

to the provided URI in the browser. In either case, if the app is

already installed, opens the app.



Adds unit tests for CompanionAppBrokerImpl.



Tested: Manually verified that when the app is installed, the original

open app notification is shown and can open the app directly, and if the

app is not installed and the play store link is provided, the play store

page is opened instead of going to the web page directly. Also ran unit

tests.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Not adding tests for preexisting methods in FastPairPresenter or Mediator. QuickPairBrowserDelegate missing test file; added methods are simple wrappers for delegated calls.



Screenshots:

https://photos.app.goo.gl/zSZ48W75nNPYVP896

https://photos.app.goo.gl/oL2Av2bzN5ce18D36

https://photos.app.goo.gl/ipRHCSbApg6qNzfU7

https://photos.app.goo.gl/vYiCNFdx1zddXZaQA



Bug: b/290816916

Change-Id: I012e4bc9d96850a9f6da70800b3eca29007be095

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4836654

entry.title: Set Animated LCP changes on by default
entry.content:
This specifically enables the LCPAnimatedImagesReporting and

LCPVideoFirstFrame flags, controlling whether LCP should be emitted

with the first displayed frame of animated bitmaps and videos,

respectively. These changes are currently being enabled via field

trials, but should be on by default in future Chrome releases.



Bug: 1289664,1260953

entry.title: [text-autospace] Fix when `LayoutNGShapeCache` is enabled
entry.content:
This patch disables `LayoutNGShapeCache` if `text-autospace`

may apply to the `ShapeResult`.



Because `text-autospace` modifies the `ShapeResult` similar to

`letter-/word-space`, `LayoutNGShapeCache` should be disabled.



To do this, `TextAutoSpace` is split into two parts; one to

initialize `RunSegmenterRanges` and determine if it may apply,

and the later part that actually applies the spacing.



Bug: 1463890

Change-Id: I4ba58a75c9e5ebcb564a8ab1f81eb989736a4eb2

entry.title: Move ownership of sockets to QuicChromiumPacketReaders
entry.content:
Packet readers and sockets have a 1:1 relationship i.e. every socket

has a reader and each reader is associated with a socket it reads from.

Hence, to simplify the ownership and socket lifetime, we create the

packet reader with the socket, and use it to access the socket whenever

that is needed. This ensures that the list of sockets and

packet readers do not go out of sync.



Bug: 1449478

Change-Id: I978b36af928e81123669b84cf2ce0f17dc5aaab9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4835289

entry.title: Implement the cache storage source in WebIDL.
entry.content:
This CL make ServiceWorker static routing API use the cache source.



The cache source can be used in two ways:

1. to look up from all cache objects.

You do not need to set cacheName. Just set the "cache" enum in source.

e.g. source: "cache"



2. to look up from the specific cache object.

Set cacheName explicitly.

e.g. source: {cacheName: "name"}



Change-Id: Ib13991ec66c4f181c54e01777ed9398fc91ffe68

Bug: 1371756

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4834553

Commit-Queue: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Reviewed-by: Minoru Chikamune

entry.title: Default phone numbers to national numbers
entry.content:
Currently our local heuristics classify simple phone number forms as

PHONE_HOME_WHOLE_NUMBER (i.e. an international phone number starting

with + country code), while our crowdsourcing prefers

PHONE_HOME_CITY_AND_NUMBER.



With the feature kAutofillDefaultToCityAndNumber, the local heuristics

follow the same strategy as crowdsourcing, except if we find a "+" in

the field label as that may indicate an example to the user (like "+49

...").



Bug: 1474308

entry.title: BRP: Force developers to use the facade header for raw_*.
entry.content:
To make PartitionAlloc usable as a library, I am going to move its

location. Unfortunately, developers are very frequently using the direct

header to import it. This happens daily. This patch adds a BanRule to

ask them to use the facade instead.



Alternatively, we could us GN visibility rules to allow only "base" from

depending directly on "partition_alloc". For now, I ignored this option,

because partition_alloc is used by pdfium, and other third_parties will

be added. I think it would be nice to separate partition_alloc into a

public and private parts first, if we want to going into this direction.



Bug: chromium:1472306,chromium:1467773

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Change-Id: I057439c33538f22961887fb260629d5e59c491d5

entry.title: Generate depfile for nocompile tests on Windows.
entry.content:
Since MSVC/clang-cl do not natively generates .d files, and clang does

not support the `-MMD` flag in CL mode, the nocompile driver fakes it

by using the MSVC `/showIncludes` flag and then manually transforming

stdout from the compiler into the .d form expected by rest of the

toolchain.



Bug: 1442625

entry.title: wayland: avoid name collision in WaylandBufferHandle
entry.content:
Rename wl_buffer getter so that it does not collide with libwayland

struct of the same name. This allows us to get rid of 'struct' tag in

those source files, increasing consistency with other wayland object

wrappers.



R=fangzhoug, tonikitoo@igalia.com

entry.title: [iOS] Highlight initial action on overflow menu customization
entry.content:
This CL adds code to allow Overflow Menu Actions to be highlighted. The

highlight will show in the UI before it fades out after 2 seconds. Then,

the owning code can set this variable before the menu is presented, so

it starts out highlighted.



While working on this, I also noticed that when edit mode begins, if

the sheet starts in medium detent, it doesn't animate to large detent

but just goes immediately. So I enclosed that in an animation block as

well.
